summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her access in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate to whom discovery materials are being transmitted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for her criminal case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case against defendant Maxwell, and her office is transmitting discovery materials to Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center for her access in her criminal case.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal letter dated July 13, 2021, from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the Metropolitan Detention Center.
The letter pertains to the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)'.
The purpose of the letter is to transmit discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell (Inmate #02879-509) for her access.
The letter is signed by Audrey Strauss, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at that time.
